p: Meindrawana et al. [ 43] established that on day 13 of storage, the decline in the total acidity of mangoes exposed to CZ 0.5 and CZ 1 NP coating treatments was significantly lower than that in the control samples. The CO 2 production peak occurred after 7 d of storage, where the mangoes in the control sample produced the highest level of CO 2. Until day 33, minimal degradation was evident in the mangoes with CZ 0.5 coatings compared to samples without coatings. Compared with carrageenan coatings, adding ZnO NPs promoted weight loss in the fruit.
